abstract.abstracttext:
To compare the efficacy of
bimatoprost/timolol
or
travoprost/timolol
fixed combinations on intraocular pressure reduction in an Egyptian population.

Patients
with primary open angle glaucoma were randomized to receive either Bimatoprost/Timolol or TTFC. Intraocular Pressures were measured at baseline, _POFT_, and _POFT_, _POFT_, 4, and _POFT_. The primary outcome measure was the mean
change
in Intraocular Pressure from baseline at each visit. Secondary outcome measures included the incidence of adverse events.

Eighty patients (80 eyes) were included finally: 40 eyes in each group. Baseline mean Intraocular Pressures were 24.78 +/ 3.53 and 25.26 +/ 3.51 mmHg for Bimatoprost/Timolol and TTFC, respectively _PVAL_. Both drops provided statistically significant Intraocular Pressure reductions from baseline at all visits _PVAL_. Bimatoprost/Timolol provided greater significant mean Intraocular Pressure reductions from baseline than TTFC at each visit _PVAL_. Mean Intraocular Pressure reductions were
11.34
and
6.42 mmHg
at _POFT_ _PVAL_, and 11.17 and 7.89 mmHg at _POFT_ _PVAL_ for Bimatoprost/Timolol and TTFC, respectively. Intraocular Pressures at _POFT_ were ≤18 mmHg in 36 _MEAS_ versus 22 _MEAS_ eyes and ≤16 mmHg in 28 _MEAS_ versus 16 _MEAS_ eyes _PVAL_, and at _POFT_, ≤18 mmHg in 38 _MEAS_ versus 28 _MEAS_ eyes and ≤16 mmHg in 30 _MEAS_ versus 18 _MEAS_ eyes for Bimatoprost/Timolol and TTFC, respectively _PVAL_.
Both drops provided effective Intraocular Pressure reduction that was greater and patients were more likely to achieve lower target pressures with Bimatoprost/Timolol than with TTFC.

body.title: Bimatoprost/timolol versus travoprost/timolol fixed combinations in an Egyptian population: a hospital-based prospective randomized study.
